message.content:
We have an “Initial” fixed assets balance coming from the Initial20231231001 row (“Fixed Assets” row) and then many transactions on 2023‑12‑31 increase fixed assets (by purchasing heavy equipment) while later “Sale” transactions with fixed‑asset products remove those items. Finally the depreciation transactions reduce the book value further. One may “net‐off” all these to get the final net fixed assets.

Step 1. Initial balance 
 • From the “Initial20231231001” row with type “Fixed Assets” the value is 8,000,000.00.

Step 2. Compute all “additions” (purchases that add to fixed assets)
They come from purchase-type (or FixedAsset–type) transactions that refer to heavy equipment or similar. In our list these are (all amounts are in monetary units):

 1. Purchase20231231001 (Heavy Equipment B):       800,000.00  
 2. Purchase20231231002 (Heavy Equipment C, quantity 2):  2,000,000.00  
 3. Purchase20231231003 (Heavy Equipment B):       800,000.00  
 4. Purchase20231231004 (Heavy Equipment A, quantity 2):  1,000,000.00  
 5. Purchase20231231005 (Heavy Equipment D, quantity 2):  3,000,000.00  
 6. Purchase20231231006 (Heavy Equipment B):       800,000.00  
 7. FixedAsset20231231001 (Fixed Assets Purchase – “Heavy Machinery4”): 871,751.87  
 8. Purchase20231231007 (Heavy Equipment B):       800,000.00  
 9. Purchase20231231008 (Heavy Equipment D, quantity 2):  3,000,000.00  
 10. Purchase20231231009 (Heavy Equipment A, quantity 2):  1,000,000.00  
 11. Purchase20231231010 (Heavy Equipment C, quantity 2):  2,000,000.00  
 12. Purchase20231231011 (Heavy Equipment D, quantity 2):  1,000,000.00  
 13. Purchase20231231012 (Heavy Equipment D, quantity 2):  3,000,000.00  

Summing these additions step‐by‐step:
 800,000 + 2,000,000 = 2,800,000  
 + 800,000 = 3,600,000  
 + 1,000,000 = 4,600,000  
 + 3,000,000 = 7,600,000  
 + 800,000 = 8,400,000  
 + 871,751.87 = 9,271,751.87  
 + 800,000 = 10,071,751.87  
 + 3,000,000 = 13,071,751.87  
 + 1,000,000 = 14,071,751.87  
 + 2,000,000 = 16,071,751.87  
 + 1,000,000 = 17,071,751.87  
 + 3,000,000 = 20,071,751.87  

So total additions = 20,071,751.87.

Step 3. Compute “disposals” from sales (removals of fixed assets)
These are sales whose product is one of the heavy equipment items (A/B/C/D). The “cost_amount” in a sale transaction represents the cost (or carrying value) of the disposed asset. The relevant sale transactions are:

 • Sale20240103001 (Heavy Equipment B):   800,000.00  
 • Sale20240106004 (Heavy Equipment A):   500,000.00  
 • Sale20240107005 (Heavy Equipment C):   1,000,000.00  
 • Sale20240108008 (Heavy Equipment B):   800,000.00  
 • Sale20240109009 (Heavy Equipment D):   1,500,000.00  
 • Sale20240111011 (Heavy Equipment D):   1,500,000.00  
 • Sale20240117017 (Heavy Equipment A):   500,000.00  
 • Sale20240122024 (Heavy Equipment A):   500,000.00  
 • Sale20240124028 (Heavy Equipment A):   500,000.00  
 • Sale20240125030 (Heavy Equipment C):   1,000,000.00  
 • Sale20240129034 (Heavy Equipment D):   1,500,000.00  
 • Sale20240131038 (Heavy Equipment D):   1,500,000.00  
 • Sale20240205042 (Heavy Equipment D):   1,500,000.00  

Now summing these:
 800,000  
+ 500,000 = 1,300,000  
+ 1,000,000 = 2,300,000  
+ 800,000 = 3,100,000  
+ 1,500,000 = 4,600,000  
+ 1,500,000 = 6,100,000  
+ 500,000 = 6,600,000  
+ 500,000 = 7,100,000  
+ 500,000 = 7,600,000  
+ 1,000,000 = 8,600,000  
+ 1,500,000 = 10,100,000  
+ 1,500,000 = 11,600,000  
+ 1,500,000 = 13,100,000  

So total disposals = 13,100,000.00.

Step 4. Combine initial and additions then subtract disposals
 Total before depreciation = Initial + Additions – Disposals  
  = 8,000,000.00 + 20,071,751.87 – 13,100,000.00  
  = 28,071,751.87 – 13,100,000.00  
  = 14,971,751.87

Step 5. Subtract “depreciation” (which reduces the net book value)
The depreciation transactions are:
 • Depreciation20240101001: 45,751.31  
 • Depreciation20240201002: 93,206.48  
Total depreciation = 45,751.31 + 93,206.48 = 138,957.79

Step 6. Final net fixed assets value calculation:
 Net Fixed Assets End Value = (Initial + Additions – Disposals) – Depreciation  
  = 14,971,751.87 – 138,957.79  
  ≈ 14,832,794.08

Thus the answers are:

• Fixed assets net Initial Value: 8,000,000.00  
• Fixed assets net End Value: 14,832,794.08

Presenting our answer in the required json format:

{
  "solution": {
    "fixed assets net Initial Value": "8000000.00",
    "fixed assets net End Value": "14832794.08"
  }
}
